allBlogs.title: How Did We Get Here? — A Philosopher's Lens on the Global Political Crisis
allBlogs.blogBody:
The question "How did we get here?" is deceptively simple. It invites not just a timeline of events, but a deeper excavation of ideas, values, and choices that have shaped today's global political atmosphere. From a philosopher's standpoint, this moment in human history is not an accident. It is the logical consequence of trajectories set in motion centuries ago—of ideologies inherited, forgotten, revived, and now combusting under the weight of complexity.

We live in an age where politics feels more like performance than governance. Across continents, we see the rise of populism, the erosion of democratic norms, the manipulation of truth, and a disillusioned citizenry caught between tribal loyalty and existential fatigue. But philosophy asks us to slow down, to look beyond headlines, and to recognize that these are not isolated phenomena. They are symptoms of deeper moral and structural decay.

One root can be traced to the Enlightenment, where reason triumphed over tradition and human autonomy became sacred. While this gave rise to democracy, science, and individual rights, it also birthed a new paradox: the elevation of the self as sovereign. In this shift, communal responsibility gradually gave way to personal freedom—until freedom became entitlement, and entitlement, expectation. Our political institutions, once built on the tension between freedom and order, now struggle to balance the clamor of individual voices with the cohesion of a shared social vision.

Fast-forward to the 20th century, the wars, decolonization, and ideological clashes between capitalism and communism left behind nations in search of identity. Economic systems grew increasingly global, but political systems remained national and reactive. The result: a global village with fractured leadership. In the vacuum, power gravitated to spectacle—to those who could entertain, provoke, or promise restoration rather than evolution. Truth became negotiable, filtered through algorithms, echo chambers, and emotion.

So how did we get here? The philosopher would say: we stopped asking what kind of society we want to be, and instead began asking only what we can get from it. Politics became transactional, not transformational. Leadership became short-termist. Citizens became consumers of narratives, not participants in governance.

But all is not lost.

In fact, the very chaos we face could be the philosophical nudge we need. For if history has taught us anything, it is that disillusionment often precedes awakening. This moment offers a powerful invitation—not just to vote differently, but to think differently. To revive public ethics. To question the systems we have normalized. To reimagine power not as dominance, but as stewardship.

We got here through ideas. Perhaps, it is through better ones that we'll find our way out.

allBlogs.title: The car of my dreams: The all-new 2025 Toyota 4Runner, redesigned exterior and interior, new turbocharged four-cylinder engine, and enhanced technology features.
allBlogs.blogBody:
The Toyota 4Runner has always had a legendary reputation, and for years, I've admired it from afar. But the 2025 model? This one feels like it was built just for me. As someone who has followed Toyota's rugged SUV lineup for a long time, I can confidently say that my dream car is finally alive.

A Fresh Look with Classic Ruggedness

The first thing that caught my eye is the updated design. Toyota managed to modernize the 4Runner without losing its signature toughness. The bold lines, aggressive stance, and refreshed grille scream adventure. It's still unmistakably a 4Runner, but sharper, meaner, and ready for anything.

I love that Toyota stayed true to the 4Runner's DNA—this isn't just another city SUV dressed up to look rugged. The 2025 4Runner looks like it belongs on mountain trails, desert sands, and muddy backroads.

Power and Performance That Inspire Confidence

The heart of any 4Runner is its capability, and the 2025 version is no exception. Toyota introduced a new turbocharged four-cylinder engine, delivering both better efficiency and strong torque. There's also a hybrid option, which makes me even more excited—imagine that balance of power and responsibility!

But what really excites me is the 4Runner's off-road pedigree. With multiple terrain modes, locking differentials, and serious ground clearance, it's like Toyota designed it to handle every wild adventure I've ever dreamed of.

A Cabin Built for Comfort and Adventure

One of my favourite surprises in the 2025 4Runner is its interior. Toyota finally gave us a modern, tech-savvy cabin while still keeping it practical. The new infotainment system feels sharp, responsive, and intuitive. Apple CarPlay, Android Auto, and even a massive digital cluster are included—it feels futuristic without being overwhelming.

The seats are spacious, supportive, and durable. Whether I'm on a long road trip or bouncing along a trail, I know I'll be riding in comfort. There's also plenty of cargo space for gear, which means this SUV is as much about practicality as it is about passion.

Safety and Reliability That Matter

Toyota didn't forget about safety either. The 2025 4Runner comes equipped with Toyota Safety Sense 3.0, giving me confidence on every journey. From adaptive cruise control to lane departure alerts, it feels like the 4Runner has my back no matter where I go.

And, of course, it's a Toyota—which means reliability is practically guaranteed. That's one of the biggest reasons I've always wanted this SUV. It's not just about having an adventure vehicle today; it's about knowing it will be with me for many years.

Why the 2025 4Runner is My Dream Car

For me, the 2025 Toyota 4Runner is everything I've ever wanted in an SUV: rugged looks, unbeatable capability, modern tech, and Toyota reliability. It's not just a vehicle; it's a lifestyle. Owning one means freedom, exploration, and confidence to chase every adventure.The 2025 4Runner isn't just a car—it's my dream come true.

allBlogs.title: The 2013 Infiniti JX35: A mid-size luxury crossover SUV known for its three-row seating and spacious interior.
allBlogs.blogBody: The 2025 Toyota 4Runner is a completely redesigned SUV, replacing the previous generation's V6 engine with a turbocharged four-cylinder, available in both standard and hybrid versions. It shares its platform with the Tacoma pickup truck and boasts enhanced fuel economy, more low-end torque, and increased towing capacity. The new 4Runner retains its rugged, square-jawed design and includes features like a power rear window, and offers a variety of trims including the TRD Pro and Trailhunter.

allBlogs.title: Feminism in Islam - Focus on gender equality and social justice within an Islamic framework
allBlogs.blogBody:
Islamic feminism

Islamic feminism rm of feminism focused on gender equality and social justice within an Islamic framework. It seeks to reconcile Islamic teachings with feminist ideals, emphasizing the full equality of all Muslims, regardless of gender, in both public and private life. This involves reinterpreting religious texts, challenging traditional interpretations, and advocating for women's rights based on both Islamic principles and human rights.

Core Principles

Equality: Islamic feminists believe that Islam, at its core promotes equality between men and women.

Reinterpretation of Texts: They engage in reinterpreting the Quran and Sunnah (Prophet Muhammad's teachings and practices) to challenge interpretations that historically led to gender inequality.

Social Justice: They advocate for social justice and women's rights within an Islamic framework, add issues like access to education, work, and legal rights.

Critique of Patriarchy: They critique patriarchal interpretations of Islamic texts and traditions that have historically disadvantaged women.

Key Aspects

Hermeneutics: Islamic feminists employ hermeneutical approaches (methods of interpretation) to analyze religious texts, focusing on context, language, and historical backkground to understand their meaning for women.

Feminist Theology: They engage in feminist theology, re-evaluating religious traditions, practices, and scriptures from a feminist perspective.

Advocacy: They actively advocate for women's rights within Muslim communities and broader society, promoting gender equality in various spheres.

Examples of Islamic Feminist Thinkers

Amina: A prominent scholar known for her work on Quranic interpretation and gender equality.

Fatema Mernissi: A sociologist and writer who explored the historical and social context of women in Islam.

Asma Barlas: A scholar who challenges patriarchal interpretations of the Quran.

Ziba Mir-Hosseini: A legal anthropologist and co-founder of the Musawah movement, which advocates for gender equality in Muslim family law, according to Refinery29.

In essence, Islamic feminism seeks to reclaim the egalitarian potential of Islam and empower Muslim women to participate fully in all aspects of life, while remaining grounded in their faith.
